v8:item.v8:content: If you want to synchronize data with other applications or configure a distributed infobase, click "New data synchronization". You can configure scheduled synchronization or synchronize data manually at any time.
User does not have rights to synchronize

If you want to synchronize data with other applications or configure a distributed infobase, contact the infobase administrator. They can configure scheduled synchronization or synchronize data manually at any time.
Synchronization paused, user has right to update
To continue with data synchronization, please update the application.
Synchronization paused, user has no right to update
Data synchronization is paused because an update is pending. Please contact the administrator.
Configuration extensions are changed. To continue with the changes made, <link 1>restart</> the application.
Synchronization loop is found. For more information, follow the <link 1>link</>.
Information about switching to Internet connection (picture)

For some synchronizations, you can configure exchange over the Internet (web service). It allows you to speed up the exchange and set up a more flexible synchronization schedule. To switch to exchange using a web service, use the switch to Internet connection wizard from the list: . Do not offer to switch to a web service again. You can call the wizard in the More actions menu of a synchronization node.
Applications context menu data exchange group
If the check box is selected, the synchronization schedule is configured.
Receiving the list of configured data synchronizations. Please wait…

The prefix is added automatically to catalog item codes and document numbers to see which application they were entered in and avoid data duplication. The prefix is entered in the administration panel before setting up the first synchronization and remains unchanged as long as there is at least one synchronization in the infobase.
Go to data receipt event log.
Go to data sending event log.
Delete the data synchronization settings item.
